reviewText: First, this is an action comedy. It's not a drama. It's the same genre as the old "Lethal Weapon" and "48 Hours" and "Beverly Hills Cop" movies - except with the updated humor and sophistication of the best of Schwarzenegger et al. Light, nonstop, hilarious, action-packed, irreverent, violent, fun. The banter is perfect between Glover and Trejo - and I hope "the Dannys" make a few sequels together. It would only work together. The chemistry is a crucial component of why this works. (Such as when Glover calls Trejo a "damn Mexican MacGuyver" after they make an escape.) Watch it expecting nothing more or less than popcorn-munching fun, and you'll enjoy it the way it's meant to be enjoyed.Note: brief topless nudity. Violence sometimes intense, probably not appropriate for kids. F-bombs throughout.
summary: Fun like they used to make 'em!

reviewText: This is a solid film that I enjoyed watching.  Trejo and Glover are really good and make what is a basic plot driven movie shine brightly.  I liked this film a lot.

reviewText: Being a fan of the first Bad Ass movie, I had to see this one.It didn't disappoint.I laughed so much. I was excited when some of these young pups got their asses handed to them by a couple of older fellas. They were pretty cocky before hand. But surely not after that.It helped this movie had a decent story line too. I felt like the first movie, the actual story part fell flat, but not this one.I thought I liked Danny Glover before, but believe me, I'm a bigger fan now. His character took me by surprise. And Danny Trejo has been a fave of mine since the first time I saw his act. He's part of the reason I watched this series.I think a lot of people, man or woman, will enjoy this film. It has a barrel of laughs and kicks butt like it promises.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This movie gives the viewers exactly what they want, great one liners, 2 fan favorites with good on screen chemistry and a whole lot of exactly what you would expect based on the name.  This is a sequel to the original Badass which was not a bad movie, but this take that and defiantly ups it a notch.  At times it almost gave me a Lethal Weapon vibe thanks to Danny Glovers amazing performance.  This is a must buy for anyone that does not take movies too seriously and enjoys a good action comedy movie...which are so far and few between these days.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Formula mindless ripoff of the following:1. Convenience store hold up with Glover and Trejo meting out judgement in what looked like a couple of nursing home hobblers utilizing very fake slap downs that failed even with all camera angles attempting to rescue the scenes.2. Trejo runs the stereotypic boxing/fight club to rescue youth from making a real good living selling.3. A member of said fight club faces the grim reaper at the hands of the (yawn, ho-hum) mob.4. Trejo and Glover again display their sadly out-of-shape bodies in a quest of revenge for deceased club member.5. Usual poorly acted, scripted hobblers go after the bad guys and win. Duh!

reviewText: The first one had a certain charm going for it, even though its script was a little on the poor side. But Danny Trejo was great, and that title song ("Ba-Ba-Ba-Bad Ass...") had me in stitches just thinking about it for a few days after.This however, is an absolute piece of junk. It's a product of laziness and falls well below standard direct to home video fair. I saw the trailer, and was really hoping for a good time. There was a shot of Danny Glover in a green tracksuit and Danny Trejo with a fannypack walking in slow motion, and it had me sold on the movie. All it had to do was have more of that with some good jokes and I'd have had a good old time.But this turned out to be The Expendables for the under 70 IQ. No actually, that's insulting to them. Even they wouldn't enjoy it. It's not funny. It's not exciting. Danny Glover especially deserves better than this. Don't watch it, it's not worth wasting your life on.

reviewerName: The Movie Guy "Movies from A to Z"
reviewText: Boxing instructor and prune juice junkie Frank (Danny Trejo) teams up with high sticking curmudgeon Bernie (Danny Glover) to avenge the death of a young drug dealing boxer. The plot is predictable. The film is filled with cliches and corny humor poking fun at old men.This is  a fun comedy/action film. Where else are you going to see Trejo playing Barbies?Bad Ass 3 is in post production and should be out in 2015.Parental Guide: F-bomb. No sex or nudity. Sarah Dumont bra/panties and double majors.
summary: NEXT TIME I'LL BRING A DESSERT
Title: N/A

reviewText: "I know who you are Mr. Vega. What happened to you on that bus was no accident. You were meant to do good in a city that needs it." Frank Vega (Trejo) has become a local celebrity as well as a law enforcement deputy after his dealing with thugs on a bus. He tries to live a quiet life and splits his time between training young boxers and visiting his friend Bernie (Glover). When one of the most promising young men he was training ends up dead in a drug related murder his mother asks Frank to help. When the police aren't doing enough it is once again up to him to clean up the city, but this time he has help. There are two types of movies Hollywood does now...re-makes and sequels rather the original needs one or not. This is a perfect example of a movie that didn't need a sequel. The first one was OK but when it ended I didn't think, I wish I knew what happened to him next. This is just another movie with Danny Trejo playing Danny Trejo, I do like him but he doesn't need to be in 90 movies a year. Overall, this is really a movie made for people who liked the first one and fans of Danny Trejo, everyone else may or may not enjoy it. I thought it wasn't needed. I give this a C+.
summary: Movie made for people who liked the 1st one & fans of Trejo, everyone else may or may not enjoy it. I thought it wasn't needed
Title: N/A

reviewText: I just watched this movie last night.  I bought it because the Dannies Glover and Trejo were in it together.  I've adored Mr. Glover for years and really enjoyed all of his performances in the "Lethal Weapon" movies and everywhere else I could find him. Although I have no idea how old Mr. Glover is, I know that Mr. Trejo is almost 70.  I would never have guessed it.  Although Mr. Trejo tried to look like an aging boxer, a glimpse at his massive back and shoulder muscles in his thong backed tank top at the beginning of the movie tells the truth(Thank you, producers and directors, for that scene!). He also sported an impressive beard which is about the only way possible to make him look old--was it natural or make up?  Mr. Glover has one of those adorable faces that you just can't resist and both of these wonderful gents are very lovable in this movie. I loved the scene where they dressed for their adventure in crime fighting and each has a closet full of identical sets of clothing. I also loved that they took public transportation--taxi's and buses.  I loved the scene with Lonnie love in the property department of the police station. I loved the scene in the college dorm where Mr. Glover impresses the cute college co-ed who is pretty much naked, and I always love that the Dannies ended up with the girls. The movie is a playful romp through Los Angeles (one of the arch baddies talks about the pacific coast highway (PCH)) with the Dannies laying waste to all of the drug smuggling bad guys in pursuit of a murderer, a diplomat with immunity to everything, even to good taste and intelligence it seems.  But he is no match for the delightful Dannies.I will be keeping this for my collection and will be watching it again!
summary: My two favorite Dans did a good job of entertaining me
